channel.title: Combat levels in pvp

item.title: Combat levels in pvp
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

int low = combatLevel - 12;
int high = combatLevel + 12;
if(low < 3) {
  low = 3;
} else if(high > 126) {
  high = 126;
}
getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@"+low+"@yel@ - @red@"+high", 199);

Read full topic

item.title: Combat levels in pvp
item.dc:creator: @Brandontan Brandontan
item.description:
@Brandontan wrote:

in that case you could try this…

[code]public void HighAndLow(){
if (combatLevel < 15){
int Low = 3;
int High = combatLevel + 12;
getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@"+Low+"@yel@ - @red@"+High+"", 199);

                                            }
    if (combatLevel > 15 && combatLevel < 126){
                    int Low = combatLevel - 12;
                    int High = combatLevel + 12;
                            getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@"+Low+"@yel@ - @red@"+High+"", 199);

                                            }

if (combatLevel > 126){
int Low = combatLevel - 12;
int High = 138;
getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@"+Low+"@yel@ - @red@"+High+"", 199);

                                            }
                                            }[/code]

just re-EDITED

Read full topic

item.title: Combat levels in pvp
item.dc:creator: @Brandontan Brandontan
item.description:
@Brandontan wrote:

If this doesn’t fix it, its going to be somewhere different than that method

[code]ublic void HighAndLow(){
if (combatLevel < 15){
int Low = 3;
int High = combatLevel + 12;
getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@"+Low+"@yel@ - @red@"+High+"", 199);

					}
if (combatLevel > 15 && combatLevel < 114){
		int Low = combatLevel - 12;
		int High = combatLevel + 12;
			getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@"+Low+"@yel@ - @red@"+High+"", 199);

					}
if (combatLevel > 114){
		int Low = combatLevel - 12;
		int High = 138;
			getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@"+Low+"@yel@ - @red@"+High+"", 199);

					}
					}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Combat levels in pvp
item.dc:creator: @EXIL3 EXIL3
item.description:
@EXIL3 wrote:

[code]public void HighAndLow(){
if (combatLevel < 15){
int Low = 3;
int High = combatLevel + 12;
getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@"+Low+"@yel@ - @red@"+High+"", 199);

					}
if (combatLevel > 15 && combatLevel < 114){
		int Low = combatLevel - 12;
		int High = combatLevel + 12;
			getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@"+Low+"@yel@ - @red@"+High+"", 199);

					}
if (combatLevel > 114 && combatLevel < 126){
		int Low = combatLevel - 12;
		int High = combatLevel + 12;
			getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@"+Low+"@yel@ - @red@"+High+"", 199);

					}
if (combatLevel > 126) {
	int Low = combatLevel - 12;
	int High = 138;
			getPA().sendFrame("@gre@"+Low+"@yel@ - @red@"+High+"", 199);
					}
					}[/code]

but instead it just shows “3-12”

Read full topic
